PROCUREMENT CONTRACT 
This Procurement Contract (the "Contract") is entered into between Chirayan Constructions, 
hereinafter referred to as the "Supplier," and Plasma Corporation, hereinafter referred to as the 
"Buyer." 
1. TERM 
1.1 Effective Date: This Contract shall become effective on October 1, 2022. 
1.2 Expiry Date: The initial term of this Contract shall be for a period of 2 years from the 
Effective Date, unless terminated earlier as per the terms of this Contract. 
2. SUPPLIER DETAILS 
Supplier Name: Chirayan Constructions Address: 123 Main Street, Anytown, USA Contact 
Person: John Smith Email: john@abcsuppliers.com Phone: +1-123-456-7890 
3. PURCHASE DETAILS 
3.1 Product/Service Description: The Supplier shall provide the following products/services to 
the Buyer: 
• Product A 
• Product B 
• Product C 
3.2 Volume Discounts: The Buyer and the Supplier agree to the following volume discounts 
based on the cumulative purchase volume during the Contract term: 
• 100 units - 500 units: 5% discount 
• 501 units - 1000 units: 10% discount 
• Over 1000 units: 15% discount 
3.3 Pricing: The pricing for the products/services shall be as follows: 
• Product A: $10 per unit 
• Product B: $20 per unit 
• Product C: $30 per unit 
4. PAYMENT TERMS 
4.1 Invoicing: The Supplier shall submit invoices to the Buyer for the products/services provided 
as per the agreed-upon pricing and terms. 
4.2 Payment Terms: The Buyer shall make payments to the Supplier within 30 days from the 
receipt of a valid invoice. 
4.3 Payment Method: Payments shall be made via bank transfer, as agreed upon by both 
parties. 
5. CONTRACT TERMINATION 
5.1 Termination for Convenience: Either party may terminate this Contract with 30 days written 
notice to the other party. 
5.2 Termination for Cause: Either party may terminate this Contract immediately in the event of 
a material breach by the other party. 
6. CONFIDENTIALITY 
6.1 Confidential Information: Both parties agree to keep any confidential information shared 
during the course of this Contract confidential and not to disclose it to any third party without 
prior written consent. 
6.2 Return of Information: Upon termination of this Contract, both parties shall promptly return 
any confidential information received from the other party. 
7. GOVERNING LAW 

page - [1]
This Contract shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of 
California. 
8. ENTIRE AGREEMENT 
This Contract constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior 
agreements, understandings, or representations, whether written or oral, relating to the subject 
matter hereof. 
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Procurement Contract as of the 
Effective Date. 
Chirayan Constructions 
Plasma Corporation Environmental Sustainability Criteria 
September 2022 Page 2 of 3 
(d) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain Plasma Corporation product/service 
specific ES 
data (Product/ Service Carbon Footprint), and shall make it available to Plasma Corporation on 
annual basis. 
For this, they shall follow industry framework e.g. Partnership for Carbon Transparency (PACT) 
framework developed by the World Business Council for Sustain-able Development (WBCSD). 
(e) Supplier and its Affiliates shall allow Plasma Corporation to report their ES related data 
regarding 
products and/or services procured by Plasma Corporation and/or its Affiliates to an independent 
third-party 
platform in an anonymized form, as may be required for the purposes of ex-ternal reporting, 
benchmarking and auditing. 
4. Sustainability Standards and Commitments for the Supply Chain 
(a) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain public commitments related to car-bon 
emissions and shall align its targets with and have them approved by the Science based targets 
initiative (SBTi) (www.sciencebasedtargets.org). 
(b) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain external ES reporting and disclo-sures 
either through CDP (www.cdp.net), covering the climate change and water security modules, or 
through EcoVadis (www.ecovadis.com) in combination with PSCI (www.pscinitiative.org). 
(c) Supplier and its Affiliates shall provide, upon request from Plasma Corporation or at an agreed 
frequency, 
the relevant environmental footprint data accredited by an independent third party (e.g., 
SGS, TUEV, Bureau Veritas, etc.). 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
- 
Acknowledgment 
We refer to all existing agreement(s) between Plasma Corporation and 
................................................................. (Supplier legal entity name) that are in effect 
(“Agreement”). 
With the signing of this document, we intend to amend the Agreement in order to fully 
incorporate the above Environmental Sustainability Criteria. 
................................................................. (Supplier legal entity name) at 
........................................................................................... (Supplier address), acknowledges the 
re-ceipt of the Plasma Corporation’ Environmental Sustainability Criteria and agrees to be 
bound by 
them. This document shall be deemed part of the Agreement and any future reference to the 
Agreement shall include the Environmental Sustainability Criteria. 
Authorized Signatory 
Plasma Corporation
